articles.title: Special Envoy Group of DPRK Meets Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
Special Envoy Group of DPRK Meets Lee Myung Bak
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- The special envoy group which visited Seoul to mourn the death of ex-President Kim Dae Jung upon the authorization of Kim Jong Il, chairman of the National Defence Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, met President of south Korea Lee Myung Bak on Sunday.
					Present there from the DPRK side were Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, and Kim Yang Gon, department director of the WPK Central Committee, and from the south side Hyon In Thaek, minister of Unification, and others.
					
					 Issues of developing the relations between the north and the south were discussed there.

articles.title: Special Envoy Group Arrives in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Special Envoy Group Arrives in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- A special envoy group led by Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, which visited Seoul to mourn the death of ex-President Kim Dae Jung upon authorization of Kim Jong Il, chairman of the National Defence Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, arrived in Pyongyang on Sunday by special plane.

articles.title: Senior Party, Army and State Officials Appreciate Drama
articles.content:
Senior Party, Army and State Officials Appreciate Drama
Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- Drama "Sentry under a Neon Lamp" was staged at the Mansudae Art Theatre Sunday. 
					Among the audience were senior Party, army and state officials, chairpersons of friendly parties and officials of Party and armed forces organs, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions. 
					
					The creators and artistes of the State Theatrical Troupe successfully re-represented the drama "Sentry under a Neon Lamp" in Korean style as required by the new century and staged it, showcasing well the leaping progress made in the drama art.
					
					 Through the depiction of soldiers of a unit of the Chinese People's Liberation Army standing on guard duties in the just liberated city of Shanghai the artistes truthfully showed how a soldier on sentry under a flickering neon lamp should protect himself and the position of the revolution.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by Chief of Pyongyang Mission of AINDF
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by Chief of Pyongyang Mission of AINDF
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- Jo Il Min, chief of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front (AINDF), was interviewed by KCNA Sunday on the occasion of the 49th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's start of Songun revolutionary leadership.
					The dignity and honor of the Korean nation have been exceptionally exalted as it is led by the great illustrious commander of Songun, he noted, and went on:
					
					President Kim Il Sung, the invincible and iron-willed commander, started the great cause of Songun.
					
					This cause is being successfully carried forward by Kim Jong Il.
					
					He has pursued the Songun politics, a treasured sword for winning sure victories, thus smashing the moves of the imperialists to stifle the DPRK and reliably defending the sovereignty of the country and the nation.
					
					Kim Jong Il, who has put the national power of the DPRK on the highest level with his Songun politics, is dynamically advancing the building of a great prosperous and powerful nation.
					
					It is the firm faith of the people in the south that the future of the Korean nation is rosy and the cause of reunification is sure to be accomplished as it is led by Kim Jong Il, the peerlessly brilliant commander, who ushered in a new era of national prosperity with the might of Songun. 
					
					The vanguard fighters of the AINDF and the patriotic people in the south will wage a more dynamic struggle to achieve the independent reunification as early as possible, true to the Songun politics of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Ulji Freedom Guardian Branded as Dangerous Test Nuclear War
articles.content:
Ulji Freedom Guardian Branded as Dangerous Test Nuclear War
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- The Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises kicked off by the United States and the south Korean warmongers are ones for aggression to all intents and purposes; they are an undisguised challenge and grave threat to the peace in the Korean Peninsula and the rest of Asia. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday observes this in a signed article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The UFG is provocative saber rattling for invading the DPRK as it is aimed to drive the worst situation in the peninsula to a phase where a nuclear war may break out any time.
					
					 The situation prevailing in the peninsula which stands at the crossroads of war or peace requires the army and people of the DPRK to keep themselves in full readiness with the highest degree of vigilance.
					
					 It is the revolutionary stand and mode of counteraction for the army of the DPRK to react to the enemy's rifle with an artillery piece, its "sanctions" with merciless retaliation and its "confrontation" with all-out confrontation.
					
					 If the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean warmongers perpetrate even the slightest military provocative act of encroaching upon the sovereignty of the DPRK, its revolutionary armed forces which have grown stronger a hundred times thanks to Songun will inflict merciless and prompt crushing blows at the aggressors by mobilizing all the offensive and defensive means including nuclear deterrent.

articles.title: Puppet Authorities' Hostile Policy towards DPRK Flayed
articles.content:
Puppet Authorities' Hostile Policy towards DPRK Flayed
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Progress of south Korea issued a statement on August 18 lashing out at the south Korean puppet authorities for their confrontation with the DPRK.
					 Referring to the joint press release issued between the Korea Asia-Pacific Peace Committee and the Hyundai Group of south Korea on August 17, which called for resuming the tour of Mt. Kumgang, reenergizing the operation of the Kaesong Industrial Zone and arranging the reunion of separated families and relatives from the north and the south, etc. the statement warmly hailed and supported it.
					
					 The statement held this provided a new occasion of bringing about a fresh turn in the efforts to improve the south-north relations which headed for confrontation and crisis.
					
					 The statement pointed out that on the same day Lee Myung Bak, however, let loose a reckless remark that "his invariable policy towards the north will cause it to make changes, " suggesting that he has no will to roll back his hostile policy towards the DPRK, 
					
					 The statement noted that the organization cannot repress resentment at the Lee Myung Bak "government's" attitude to interpret the contents of the joint press release with the U.S. "sanctions" as a yardstick. 
					
					 The statement urged the Lee Myung Bak regime to drop its policy of confrontation with fellow countrymen without delay, opt for dialogue with the north, respect the joint press release and take positive measures for implementing it.
					
					 In another development, the organization issued a statement on August 20 demanding a halt to the Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises being staged by the south Korean authorities in collusion with the U.S.

articles.title: U.S.-South Korea Joint Military Exercises Blasted
articles.content:
U.S.-South Korea Joint Military Exercises Blasted
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- The Brandenburg State Committee of the Communist Party of Germany issued a statement on August 18 denouncing the Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises being staged by the United States and the south Korean puppet clique.
					 The statement noted that the DPRK-targeted UFG does not help solve the problem but escalates the tension on the Korean Peninsula as it is being staged under the unprecedentedly tense situation prevailing there these days.
					
					 All these facts go to prove that the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean warmongers are the arch criminals disturbing peace and stability on the peninsula, the statement said, and continued:
					
					 It was quite natural for the DPRK to have taken strong measures for self-defense to defend the sovereignty and dignity of the country. The statement strongly demanded the U.S. and the south Korean authorities stop at once the UFG for aggression.
					
					 It expressed full support and solidarity to the Korean people in their struggle to defend the dignity of the country and the nation.

articles.title: National Joint Seminar on Exploits of Kim Jong Il Held in Mexico
articles.content:
National Joint Seminar on Exploits of Kim Jong Il Held in Mexico
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- A Mexican national joint seminar on the Songun leadership exploits of General Secretary Kim Jong Il was held in the city of Mexico on August 17 to mark the 49th anniversary of the start of his Songun revolutionary leadership.
					 On display in the seminar venue were works of Kim Jong Il and publications on his Songun leadership feats.
					
					 Speeches were made at the seminar.
					
					 Jesus Antonio Carlos Hernandez, general secretary of the Central Committee of the People's Socialist Party of Mexico, said that the start of Kim Jong Il's Songun revolutionary leadership was an event of weighty significance in the history of the Korean revolution.
					
					 Thanks to his Songun leadership, the DPRK will always advance only along the road of victory as the indestructible socialist fortress, he stressed.
					
					 Ramon Jimenez Lopez, president of the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism, noted that Kim Jong Il started the Songun leadership with his historic on-site guidance to the Seoul Ryu Kyong Su 105 Guards Tank Division of the Korean People's Army on August 25, 1960. This was the starting point of the work to consolidate the foundation of the Songun politics for defending and carrying forward the Songun idea and cause of President Kim Il Sung, he added.
					
					 Recalling that Kim Jong Il has trained the KPA to be an invincible army reliably defending the socialist country in any situation and circumstances, he stressed: Under his Songun leadership, the Korean people will surely open the gate to a great prosperous and powerful nation in 2012.
					
					 The speakers at the seminar explained in a profound way the essence and validity of the Songun idea and its great vitality with the stirring events taking place in the DPRK.

articles.title: Day of Korea's Liberation Marked by Koreans in Kirgyzstan
articles.content:
Day of Korea's Liberation Marked by Koreans in Kirgyzstan
Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- The United Confederation of Koreans in Kirgyzstan held a function in Bishkek on August 15 to commemorate the 64th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					Present there were officials of the confederation including its Chairman Pak Kyong Ho and compatriots.
					
					The participants laid floral baskets and bouquets before the portraits of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il before paying tribute to them.
					
					Speakers at the event spoke highly of the immortal exploits the President performed by defeating the brigandish Japanese imperialists and liberating the country. 
					
					They recalled that the people in the homeland are bringing about fresh leap forward and progress day by day in building a great prosperous and powerful socialist nation under the Songun revolutionary leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					They called on the Koreans in Kirgyzstan to actively turn out in the patriotic struggle for the national reunification and prosperity, keeping pace with the compatriots in the homeland. 
					
					Then followed an art performance given on the same occasion.

articles.title: Grupo de enviados especiales se reune con Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
Grupo de enviados especiales se reune con Lee Myung Bak
Pyongyang, 23 de agosto (ATCC) -- El grupo de enviados especiales de visita en Seul para expresar condolencias por el fallecimiento del ex presidente surcoreano Kim Dae Jung, por encargo del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, se encontro el dia 23 con el presidente surcoreano Lee Myung Bak.
					Estuvieron presentes alli por la parte norcoreana el secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Kim Ki Nam, y el jefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Kim Yang Gon, y por la surcoreana, el ministro de "Reunificacion", Hyon In Thaek, etc.
					
					En la ocasion fueron discutidos los problemas de desarrollar las relaciones entre el Norte y el Sur de Corea.

articles.title: Regresa a Pyongyang el grupo de enviados especiales
articles.content:
Regresa a Pyongyang el grupo de enviados especiales
Pyongyang, 23 de agosto (ATCC) -- Regreso el dia 23 a esta capital por avion especial el grupo de enviados especiales encabezado por el secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Kim Ki Nam, que habia visitado Seul para expresar condolencias por el fallecimiento del ex presidente surcoreano Kim Dae Jung, por encargo del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
